text: Muhammad Asad Malik (October 30, 1941 â€“ July 27, 2020) was a Pakistani field hockey player. He won a silver medal at the 1964 Summer Olympics, a gold medal at the 1968 Summer Olympics in Mexico City, and a silver medal at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich.Pakistan owes its Olympic glory to hockey teams, Dawn (newspaper), Published 4 August 2016, Retrieved 24 August 2017 Malik lost his life when he was travelling on his motorcycle and met a road accident on July 27, 2020, at the age of 78.Former Olympian Asad Malik killed in road accident ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Pakistani field hockey players Category:Olympic gold medalists for Pakistan Category:Olympic silver medalists for Pakistan
title: Muhammad Asad Malik
